intro: Lomatium scabrum, commonly known as biscuit root, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fern-like, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are thick, fleshy, and have a distinctive, spicy aroma. Lomatium scabrum is often found in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
